get.summary: Retrieve item attribute document/s by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
This API will fetch item attribute documents matching the specified search criteria (also known as standard search).
The search criteria is passed as a query parameter with the API request. If more than one parameters are used, they will be applied as a logical conjunction (AND) operation.
Fields named \*Pattern support wild-card characters. Examples:
itemCodePattern=12331231 (exact match),
itemCodePattern=21\* (starts with 21),
itemCodePattern=\*32\* (contains 32),
itemCodePattern=\* (any value)

Input parameter:-

request: It contains a set of item attribute search criteria.

Returns:

A page of catalog item attribute objects that match the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: itemCodePattern
parameters.description: Item Code pattern to use for a search (standard wildcard matching rules apply).

parameters.name: attributeStatus
parameters.description: Item Attribute status to use for a search.

parameters.name: internalPriceIdPattern
parameters.description: Internal Price ID pattern to use for a search (standard wildcard matching rules apply).

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

lastPage.description: Indicates whether the return page is last.

totalPages.description: The total number of result pages available

totalResults.description: The total number of results available

pageContent.description: The results corresponding to the requested page of data

400.description: The request failed validation or exception is thrown when trying to access search results numbering greater than the result window (usually 10000 records). if you receive this exception please try to refine your search criteria or only request the first 10000 results. or this exception is thrown when trying to sort on a field (e.g. longdescription, shortdescription) that does not exist. this can occur when trying to sort on a field using a locale that you have no data for (trying to sort on long description with a fr-fr locale when you only have inserted data for the en-us locale). please check your locale and sort field an try again.

details.description: Details associated with the error. Error-specific values that provide more information on the error, such as the reason for failure or error code

items.description: Details associated with the error. Error-specific values that provide more information on the error, such as the reason for failure or error code

errorType.description: The unique fully-qualified class name identifying the exception

schema.description: An error occurred while processing a request

put.summary: Imports a mini-batch of enterprise unit specific item attributes.
put.description:
Import API will either create or update existing item-attributes documents.
If the item-attribute already exists, the document will be updated only if the version number in the request is greater than the version number of the existing document. Allows specifying multiple enterprise units in the request, with a maximum of 100 enterprise units per request. The API will perform an authorization check on the supplied enterprise units.

Input parameters:-

request: contains the list of item-attributes to save

post.summary: Retrieves a collection of item-attribute documents matching the item-identifiers in the request
post.description:
This API retrieves a set of documents for a given set of item-identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API does not fail, if any of the provided item-codes do not have corresponding attributes defined at the specified enterprise unit. This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve with a single call all enterprise unit specific attributes (e.g. store level attributes) of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.

Input parameters:-

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the item codes to use for the bulk retrieval.

Returns:

A collection of objects that represents attributes associated with catalog items at the enterprise unit level.

parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

get.summary: Retrieve an item-attribute document by the item-attribute resource identifier.
get.description:
This API retrieves a single document of item-attribute based on the provided itemAttributesId identifier. It is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header.

Input parameter:-

itemAttributesId: Resource identifier for the item attributes.

Returns:

All of the fields of a single catalog item-attributes document, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

parameters.name: itemCode
parameters.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

schema.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item attributes are defined.

schema.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item attributes are defined.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

internalPriceId.description: internalPriceId is used as an identifier for different items sold as the same.

status.description:
Status of the current item attributes. If set to INACTIVE, it means that item is not available for the specified unit. This approach allows to apply restrictions at the enterprise unit and also maintain information about the products that are 'sold' at a specific location.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • DISCONTINUED: Indicates that object is discontinued.
  • SEASONAL: Indicates that object is seasonal.
  • TO_DISCONTINUE: Indicates that object will be discontinued.
  • UNAUTHORIZED: Indicates that object is unauthorized.

dynamicAttributes.description: Customer specific dynamic attributes.

groups.description: Collection of groups that represents group memberships of the catalog item (enterprise unit level).

linkGroups.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

locations.description: Collection of location information that represents where an item is located. If multiple duplicate objects are given, will save one.

regulatoryMessages.description: Collection of messages and language codes that represents required government regulatory messages.

baggingRequired.description: Field used to determine if bagging is required for the item.

visualVerifyItem.description: Field used to determine if item requires attendant verification

schema.description: Contains all of the fields of a catalog item attributes, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

get.summary: Get the snapshot based on the provided enterprise unit.
get.description:
Item attribute document synchronization API that is used to synchronize the resource state with the remote client such as POS, Store Server or mobile device. This API requires specifying enterprise unit id that matches the client synchronization system (e.g. store server or POS). Results are filterable by STATUS using the query parameter status=desiredResourceStatus.

Input parameter:

request: Snapshot request containing snapshotVersion and enterpriseUnitId

Returns:

Snapshot that matches the request parameters (e.g. all item-attributes modified since the submitted client version.)

If the the result payload exceeds maximum size (generally around 10K records), the document synchronization cannot be accomplished using APIs. The client should wait a few moments for the file to be available at the provided URI in the details.

parameters.name: nep-enterprise-unit
parameters.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the documents are defined.

schema.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the documents are defined.

parameters.name: nep-snapshot-version
parameters.description: Version of the client state. This attribute will be used by the back-end to identify the snapshot that should be generated per client. In a simple case, the version is a timestamp (epoch time in millis) and the generated snapshot will contain all documents modified since the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Flag to filter just one status type.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

snapshot.description: Objects in the page of search results.

schema.description: List of Item-Attribute records for get request.

get.summary: Retrieve Category suggestions by the specified search criteria.
get.description:
This API retrieves suggestions that fit the provided search criteria. In this case patterns are not mapped directly to specific fields, but rather apply to the several fields that may match the pattern.
The search criteria is passed as a query parameter with the API request. If nodeCodePattern or titlePattern parameters are used, they will be applied as a logical disjunction (OR) operation. If tag, includeAncestors, or isDepartmentNode parameters are used, they will be applied a logical conjunction (AND) operation.

Input parameter:-

request: A set of suggestions search criteria.

Returns:

A page of catalog Category objects that match the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The requested page number (starting from zero)

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size

parameters.name: nodeCodePattern
parameters.description: Node Code pattern to use for suggestions (standard wildcard matching rules apply).

parameters.name: titlePattern
parameters.description: Title pattern to use for suggestions (standard wildcard matching rules apply).

parameters.name: isDepartmentNode
parameters.description: Flag to filter nodes representing a department.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag to use for suggestions.

parameters.name: includeAncestors
parameters.description: Indicates whether to include ancestors for suggestions or not. If true, includes all ancestors for each node.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

lastPage.description: Indicates whether the return page is last.

totalPages.description: The total number of result pages available

totalResults.description: The total number of results available

pageContent.description: The results corresponding to the requested page of data

schema.description: Response object containing a page of node objects along with ancestors.

get.summary: Get the snapshot for the specified parent node based on the provided client snapshot version.
get.description:
This API retrieves a snapshot for a particular parent/root node, for example, getting a full snapshot just the "primary" (or "merchandise") hierarchy, which is identified as a "primary" node id. Results are filterable by STATUS using the query parameter status=desiredResourceStatus.

Input parameter:-

request: Snapshot request containing snapshotVersion.

Returns:

Object with all of the fields of a category node, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

If the the result payload exceeds maximum size (generally around 10K records), the document synchronization cannot be accomplished using APIs. The client should wait a few moments for the file to be available at the provided URI in the details.

parameters.description: Enterprise unit id.

parameters.name: nep-snapshot-version
parameters.description: Version of the client state. This attribute will be used by the back-end to identify the snapshot that should be generated per client. In a simple case, the version is a timestamp (epoch time in millis) and the generated snapshot will contain all documents modified since the provided timestamp.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Flag to filter just one status type.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Snapshot response will be limited to the hierarchy that starts with the specified node. This allows to get updates only for a specific hierarchy, for example only for "primary" hierarchy (which maps to "merchandise" for retail).

post.summary: Retrieve a collection of matching custom item modifier documents
post.description:
This API retrieves a set of item-custom-modifier-documents for a given set of item identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API does not fail if any of the provided item codes do not have corresponding custom modifiers defined at the specified enterprise unit (instead it returns empty object response). This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve single call all custom modifiers for a given enterprise unit (e.g. store/site)with a of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.

Input parameters:-

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the item codes to use for bulk retrieval.

Returns:

A collection of the matched documents or empty collection if not matches were found.

Link group document containing writable and read-only attributes of the retrieved link group.

parameters.description: A unique (per tenant) link group code that identifies the link group.

schema.description: A unique (per tenant) link group code that identifies the link group.

parameters.name: nep-correlation-id
parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

linkGroupType.description:
Type of the link group. May drive behavior of the POS / Client when an item associated with the link group is selected for ordering.
Supported types:
  • DEPOSIT: Identifies a linked deposit, such as bottle deposit, CRV
  • MODIFIER: Identifies items that maybe used to modify the order (ingredients, warranty, activation cards, etc.)
  • SUGGESTION: Identifies suggestions that may be presented to the user. These suggestions are 'statically' defined in the catalog, as opposed to the suggestions that are dynamic in nature and depend on the transaction context (consumer information, targeted advertisement, etc.).
  • SUBSTITUTION: Identifies items that may be used as substitutions for a given item.
  • CUSTOM: Custom group type. The API client is expected to understand how handle this type of link groups.

tag.description: Tag to mark the group. This tag is expected to be understood by the client. Tag defines the type of the link group: suggestion, substitutes, kit, deposit, etc.

status.description:
Link group status. If set to inactive, indicates that the link group is 'deleted' and should not be assigned to the catalog items attributes.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • DISCONTINUED: Indicates that object is discontinued.
  • SEASONAL: Indicates that object is seasonal.
  • TO_DISCONTINUE: Indicates that object will be discontinued.
  • UNAUTHORIZED: Indicates that object is unauthorized.

posNumber.description: Uniform POS identifier, optional, non-unique, alphanumeric

linkItems.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

dynamicAttributes.description: Customer specific dynamic attributes.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier that may be used for filtering of the link groups that are relevant for the caller. It is assumed that if a request to get link groups is provided with the enterprise unit specified, then all link groups that match the enterprise unit exactly, or groups with the enterprise units that are parents of the provided enterprise unit or all groups that don't have enterprise unit specified (global groups) are applicable.

post.summary: Retrieves a collection of item-price documents matching the item-identifiers in the request
post.description:
This API retrieves a set of item-price documents for a given set of item-identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API does not fail, if any of the provided item-codes do not have corresponding item-prices (instead it returns empty object response). This API returns valid item-prices till the date of query. This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve with a single call all prices for a given enterprise unit (e.g. store/site) of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.

Input parameters:-

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the list of item-codes to use for bulk retrieval.

Returns:

A collection of the matched documents or empty collection if no matches were found.

parameters.description: Enterprise unit id which belongs to either site or a revenue center.

parameters.description: A unique ID that can be used to correlate one or more related requests for debugging or tracing purposes

parameters.name: nep-organization
parameters.description: The organization the request applies to

post.summary: Retrieve a collection of item-price documents grouped on item-codes
post.description:
Retrieves a set of item-price documents for a given set of item identifiers. This API is executed on a context of a single enterprise unit which is expected to be passed as a standard header. The API checks for the enterprise unit type as site (default) or revenue-center. If enterprise unit is of type 'revenue-center', the API would fetch the required item-prices from the revenue-center and the missing item-prices from its parent site. It groups the prices based on the type of enterprise-unit they originate from (site or revenue-center) and presents item-code wise list of prices. It will return all active prices as of date of query, if no filter date is provided. The API does not fail if any of the provided item-codes do not have the corresponding item-prices defined at the specified enterprise unit (instead it returns empty object response). This API allows clients to orchestrate multiple catalog APIs more effectively. For example, a client may run a search against global items by various supported parameters and then retrieve with a single call all prices for a given enterprise unit (e.g. store/site) of the catalog items matched by the previous search. This API has no side-effects.

Input parameters:-

request: Identifies context of the client, such as enterprise unit that the client belongs to and analyzes filterDate query param.
itemIdentifiers: Object containing the item codes to use for bulk retrieval.

Returns:

A collection of the matched documents group by the item-codes or empty collection if no matches were found.

tareWeight.description: Tare Weight of an item. This is used when items are sold by weight and the weight of its wrapper/container needs to be excluded from total weight. This allows the POS to price an item by excluding the tare weight.

precision.description: The number of decimal places allowed on the item's tare weight. Example precision=2 would have price like $1.99

includesContainer.description: Indicates whether the overall item price includes the weight/price of the container.

quantityPricedItem.description: Indicates whether the item price is associated with quantity. For example, 3 apples for $5

Indicates whether loyalty card pricing applies to the item price.
Supported types:

  • CARD_PRICE: Indicates that price is for loyalty card customers.

get.summary: Get the snapshot of current and expired prices (up to 5 days in the past) based on the provided client snapshot version.
get.description:
Item-price document synchronization API that is used to synchronize the resource state with the remote client such as POS, Store Server or mobile device. This API requires specifying enterprise unit id that matches the client synchronization system (e.g. store server or POS).
The default period in this endpoint to include expired item-prices by is one (1) day expired. This can be expanded up to five (5) days in the past by passing in an integer representing the desired number of days expired to include, with the query parameter daysExpired=0-5.
Results are filterable by STATUS using the query parameter status=desiredResourceStatus.

Input parameter:

request: Snapshot request containing snapshotVersion and enterpriseUnitId

Returns:

A snapshot that matches the request parameters (e.g. all item-prices modified since the submitted client version).

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

enterpriseUnitId.description: Enterprise unit identifier for which the item attributes are defined.

ItemAttributesIdData.description: Id data that defines attributes associated with a catalog item at the enterprise unit level. For example, for retail catalog these attributes will represent store level item configuration.

version.description: Version (normally epoch time in millis) representing the version of the object. This field is used to avoid object overrides in environments that allow concurrent modification of data.

internalPriceId.description: internalPriceId is used as an identifier for different items sold as the same.

status.description:
Status of the current item attributes. If set to INACTIVE, it means that item is not available for the specified unit. This approach allows to apply restrictions at the enterprise unit and also maintain information about the products that are 'sold' at a specific location.
Supported types:
  • ACTIVE: Indicates that object is active.
  • INACTIVE: Indicates that object is not active.
  • DISCONTINUED: Indicates that object is discontinued.
  • SEASONAL: Indicates that object is seasonal.
  • TO_DISCONTINUE: Indicates that object will be discontinued.
  • UNAUTHORIZED: Indicates that object is unauthorized.

dynamicAttributes.description: Customer specific dynamic attributes.

groups.description: Collection of groups that represents group memberships of the catalog item (enterprise unit level).

linkGroups.description: Collection of linked items that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

locations.description: Collection of location information that represents where an item is located. If multiple duplicate objects are given, will save one.

regulatoryMessages.description: Collection of messages and language codes that represents required government regulatory messages.

baggingRequired.description: Field used to determine if bagging is required for the item.

visualVerifyItem.description: Field used to determine if item requires attendant verification

ItemAttributesViewData.description: Contains all of the fields of a catalog item attributes, including read-only system generated/assigned fields.

cookTime.description: The amount of time (in seconds) the item takes to prepare. For example, if pasta from a restaurant needs 5 minutes to be prepared then the cook time of the item should be set as 300.

modifierTime.description: The amount of time (in seconds) a modifier item takes to be added to an item. This determines how the overall cook time of an item is affected by adding/deleting a modifier item to a meal. For example, if burger is an item and if lettuce has to be added on the burger as a standard modifier which has a modifier time of 10 seconds, then the total cook time of the item can be calculated by adding cook time of the burger and 10 second modifier time of the lettuce.

modifierPercentage.description: The percentage of an item's cook time it takes to be added to the item. If an item is a standard modifier, and if it affects the total cook time by 20% then the value of this field should be 20 and would in turn affect the overall preparation time of the item.

KitchenAttributes.description: Represents all kitchen related parameters for items. This kitchen attribute is optional.

linkGroupCode.description: A unique (per tenant) link group code that identifies the link group.

LinkGroupIdData.description: Represents minimum set of fields that uniquely identify a link group.

key.description: Key that identifies this key value pair.

LocalizedKeyValueData.description: Contains locale, key and value properties.

value.description: Value has range of the name.

LocalizedTextData.description: LocalizedTextData - Contains locale and value properties.

aisle.description: The aisle the item is located on.

shelf.description: The shelf the item is located on.

locationType.description: ENUM that indicates the type of location data described

section.description: the section item is located on.

LocationAttributesData.description: Represents an item's location related data.

values.description: Values containing entries per language (one entry per language is expected).

MultiLanguageTextData.description: Generic data type that is capable of holding text data in multiple languages.

nodeId.description: A unique code which is used to identify a node in hierarchy.

NodeIdData.description: Data Object to identify a node in hierarchy uniquely.

nutritionType.description:
The allowed Nutritional types are as below. These Nutritional types have a predetermined set of allowed NutritionUOM (mentioned in brackets)
  • CALORIES (CALORIES)
  • CALORIES_FROM_FAT (CALORIES)
  • FAT (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • SATURATED_FAT (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • TRANS_FAT (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • CHOLESTEROL (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • SODIUM (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • CARBOHYDRATES (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • DIETARY_FIBER (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • SUGARS (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • PROTEIN (MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS, KILOGRAMS)
  • VITAMIN_A (MICROGRAMS, MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS)
  • VITAMIN_D (MICROGRAMS, MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS)
  • VITAMIN_C (MICROGRAMS, MILLIGRAMS, GRAMS)

priceCode.description: Identifier of the price provided by the external system. It is expected to be unique in the context of the item and enterprise unit, since each combination of item code, enterprise unit and price identifier are part of the composite id. This identifier is mandatory to facilitate price updates. For example a price scheduled in the future may be cancelled and this is expected to be communicated to the clients that replicate the catalog item price document.

precision.description: The number of decimal places allowed on the item's tare weight. Example precision=2 would have price like $1.99

includesContainer.description: Indicates whether the overall item price includes the weight/price of the container.

linkGroupType.description:
Type of the link group. May drive behavior of the POS / Client when an item associated with the link group is selected for ordering.
Supported types:
  • DEPOSIT: Identifies a linked deposit, such as bottle deposit, CRV
  • MODIFIER: Identifies items that maybe used to modify the order (ingredients, warranty, activation cards, etc.)
  • SUGGESTION: Identifies suggestions that may be presented to the user. These suggestions are 'statically' defined in the catalog, as opposed to the suggestions that are dynamic in nature and depend on the transaction context (consumer information, targeted advertisement, etc.).
  • SUBSTITUTION: Identifies items that may be used as substitutions for a given item.
  • CUSTOM: Custom group type. The API client is expected to understand how handle this type of link groups.

tag.description: Tag to mark the group. This tag is expected to be understood by the client. Tag defines the type of the link group: suggestion, substitutes, kit, deposit, etc.

linkedItemIdentifiers.description: Collection of linked items unique identifiers that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

items.description: Collection of linked items unique identifiers that represents a logically connected group of the catalog items at the enterprise unit level). Linked item reference allows specifying additional attributes at the association level.

dynamicAttributes.description: Customer specific dynamic attributes.

LinkGroupDetails.description: An object to contain link group details like metadata for a link group and linked items and etc.

maxQuantity.description: Restriction defining the maximum of item instances (portions, units) can be provided as a part of the link.

minQuantity.description: Restriction defining the minimum number of item instances (portions, units) that can be provided as part of the link (group or individual item). For example, the setting of 1 will require at least one item instances to be included with the link. It can be used to define kits or strong linkage such as bottle deposit that must be sold along with the item.

freeQuantity.description: Restriction defining the number of item instances (portions, units) that can be provided free as part of the link (group or individual item). For example, the setting of 1 means that one item instance is provided at no charge.

defaultQuantity.description: Default setting of the restriction (the client will apply this setting by default). In a general case it should not contradict the min/max restrictions, however, the service will not enforce this validation.

visibilityScope.description: Defines visibility scope of the link group or item.

LinkRestrictionData.description: Represents restrictions that are set at the link item or group level.

itemCode.description: A unique item (unique per Tenant) code which is used to identify the item.

appliedAutomatically.description: If set to true, then the default value specified in the restriction is applied automatically. This allows to automatically apply certain items to the order without user interaction. Example: link item attached to the "salad" is "fork with default quantity of 1". When order is created the user is not expected to see that fork is part of the order and explicitly include it in the ordea, but fork must be in the order for fulfillment , so that whoever prepares the order does not forget to put one in.

modifierTime.description: The modifier time (in seconds) of an item based on a linked group. The modifier time in linked items takes precedence over the item attribute's modifier time. An item can have a different modifier time based on what linked group the item is apart of. For example, as a standard modifier, fries can have a modifier time of 60 seconds to be cooked, but it can have a link group modifier time of 30 seconds when it is added as a part of a combo because it can be done in parallel.

dynamicAttributes.description: Dynamic attributes stored at the linked group level. These may contain domain-specific attributes such as maxportions (e.g. two portions of ketchup are allowed with one sale of a hamburger.

linkGroupType.description:
Type of the link group. May drive behavior of the POS / Client when an item associated with the link group is selected for ordering.
Supported types:
  • DEPOSIT: Identifies a linked deposit, such as bottle deposit, CRV
  • MODIFIER: Identifies items that maybe used to modify the order (ingredients, warranty, activation cards, etc.)
  • SUGGESTION: Identifies suggestions that may be presented to the user. These suggestions are 'statically' defined in the catalog, as opposed to the suggestions that are dynamic in nature and depend on the transaction context (consumer information, targeted advertisement, etc.).
  • SUBSTITUTION: Identifies items that may be used as substitutions for a given item.
  • CUSTOM: Custom group type. The API client is expected to understand how handle this type of link groups.

tag.description: Tag to mark the group. This tag is expected to be understood by the client. Tag defines the type of the link group: suggestion, substitutes, kit, deposit, etc.

status.description:

  • SEASONAL: Indicates that object is seasonal.
  • TO_DISCONTINUE: Indicates that object will be discontinued.
  • UNAUTHORIZED: Indicates that object is unauthorized.
